title: Jennie
description: If she had been simply the mother of Winston Churchill, her place in history would have been assured. But Jennie was the most fascinating and desirable woman of her age. . . the girl from Brooklyn who became the absolute monarch of British society. . . the beautiful rebel who lived and loved with an honesty that made her the toast--and the scandal--of two continents. (from back cover)
author: Ralph G. Martin
